title: Canot on transatlantic slave trade - claim

content.question: The excerpt could best be used as evidence to support which of the following arguments?

choices.label: The transatlantic slave trade largely ended after the United States banned it in 1808.
African captives collectively resisted enslavement through various methods of resistance aboard slave ships.
Attempts by enslaved people on slave ships to revolt generally required enslaved people to share a common language.
The increased production of cotton in the United States in the mid-1800s encouraged the expansion of the domestic slave trade.

content.answer: African captives collectively resisted enslavement through various methods of resistance aboard slave ships.

topic.text: 2.4: African Resistance on Slave Ships and the Antislavery Movement
